New Records: The New York Yankees clinched their 32nd straight winning season, the second-longest such period in major league history.
Key Match Events: Clarke Schmidt and Nestor Cortes combined on a four-hitter to blank the Chicago Cubs 2-0.
Austin Wells drove in Gleyber Torres with a groundout in the first inning.
Aaron Judge swiped third base and scored on a throwing error by catcher Christian Bethancourt.
Post-Match Reflections: Nestor Cortes expressed his willingness to accept any role for the team despite initial disappointment.
Ian Happ emphasized the need for the Cubs to play better to stay in the playoff picture.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Yankees first baseman Anthony Rizzo received cheers in his second game back at Wrigley Field since being traded in July 2021.
Others: Yankees reinstated Clarke Schmidt and Ian Hamilton from the 60-day injured list before the game.
Cubs' Justin Steele was scheduled to play catch as part of his recovery from left elbow tendinitis.
